_comment: Created by ianb on 07/05/2014 13:26:08 using v2.1
title: Distribution of adult social service jobs by service group
analysis_commentary: The distribution of jobs between different service groups has changed very little from 2011 to 3013. The largest group was community care (which includes services such as: social work, information and advice, care management or community support and outreach) which made up 33% of jobs in 2013. The next largest group was residential care (which includes jobs at care homes, sheltered housing and other residential services) this was 22% in 2013. The smaller groups were other (head office jobs) with 20% of jobs in 2013, domiciliary or home care (which includes all care at home: home help, meals on wheels etc) which was 14% and the smallest group, day care and day services, which was 11% in 2013.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Personal Social Services: Staff of Social Services Departments
